text:
[Cites 
3
, Cited by 
0
]

Orissa High Court

Renu @ Renubala Udaysingh vs State Of Orissa .... Opposite Party on 16 August, 2023

Author: 
V. Narasingh

Bench: 
V. Narasingh

 IN THE HIGH COURT OF ORISSA AT CUTTACK

 BLAPL No. 7375 of 2023

 Renu @ Renubala Udaysingh .... Petitioner
 Mr. S.K. Bhanjadeo, Advocate
 -versus-

 State of Orissa .... Opposite Party
 Mr. T.K. Praharaj, SC

 CORAM: JUSTICE V. NARASINGH
 ORDER

 16.08.2023
 Order No.

02. 1. Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned counsel
 for the State.

 2. The petitioner is an accused in connection with T.R. Case
 No. 66 of 2023, pending before the Court of the learned 1st Addl.
 Sessions Judge-Cum-Special Judge, under (NDPS) Khurda, arising
 out of Khordha P.R. No. 29 of 2023-24 for alleged commission of
 offences under 
Section 21(b)
 of the N.D.P.S. Act.

 3. Being aggrieved by the rejection of his application for bail
 U/s.439 
Cr.P.C
. by the learned Spl. Judge under 
NDPS Act
, Khurda,
 by order dated 29.06.2023 in the aforementioned case, the present
 BLAPL has been filed.

 4. It is submitted by the learned counsel that the Petitioner is
 in custody since 24.06.2023 on the accusation of possessing the
 contraband (brown sugar) to the tune of 40 grams.

 5. It is stated by the learned counsel that the Petitioner is the first
 offender.

 Page 1 of 2

 6. Learned counsel for the State opposes the prayer for bail during
 currency of investigation.

 7. Taking note of the fact that the Petitioner is a lady, this Court
 directs the Petitioner to be released on bail on such terms to be fixed
 by the learned court in seisin over the matter.

 8. Before releasing, learned Court below shall verify the
 criminal antecedent of the petitioner. If it comes to fore that the
 petitioner has criminal antecedent of any nature, this order shall
 stand recalled.

 9. Additionally, it is directed that petitioner shall appear before
 the jurisdictional police station once every month till submission of
 final form and thereafter once in three months till conclusion of trial.
 Certification of such appearance shall be submitted to the Court in
 seisin.

 10. Accordingly, the BLAPL stands disposed of.

 11. Urgent certified copy of this order be granted as per rules.

 (V. NARASINGH)
 Judge
 Soumya

Signature Not Verified

Digitally Signed

Signed by: SOUMYA RANJAN SAMAL

Designation: Jr. Stenographer

Reason: Authentication

Location: High Court of Orissa
Date: 18-Aug-2023 09:22:39

 Page 2 of 2

State of Orissa .... Opposite Party

CORAM: JUSTICE V. NARASINGH

02. 1. Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and learned counsel

2. The petitioner is an accused in connection with T.R. Case

Cr.P.C
. by the learned Spl. Judge under

, Khurda,

4. It is submitted by the learned counsel that the Petitioner is

5. It is stated by the learned counsel that the Petitioner is the first

6. Learned counsel for the State opposes the prayer for bail during

9. Additionally, it is directed that petitioner shall appear before

10. Accordingly, the BLAPL stands disposed of.
11. Urgent certified copy of this order be granted as per rules.
